repnme.cdata!:
Panama - Energy Planning and Petroleum
            Exploration Promotion Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project would assist the Government
            in accelerating petroleum exploration, improving energy
            planning, and investigating the potential for development of
            energy alternatives. The project includes: (a) assistance in
            compilation of petroleum exploration information,
            negotiation of contracts with oil companies, revision of
            petroleum legislation, preparation of specialized studies,
            and monitoring of oil company activities, if required. (b)
            assistance in developing the capabilities of the Technical
            Secretariat of CONADE through staff training, the
            development of a data management system and the preparation
            of studies on pricing, energy aspects of transportation, and
            integration of the results through the formulation of a
            national energy strategy; and establish an energy library
            and an energy conservation unit. (c) an electric resistivity
            survey (a geophysical study) of a geothermal site (Cerro
            Pando), completion of analyses of 23 additional geothermal
            sites, and a preliminary field investigation of coal resources.
